"**Parc de la Butte-du-Chapeau-Rouge** is a hidden gem in Paris! Nestled away from the touristy spots, this park offers breathtaking views of the city from its elevated position. It's a peaceful, well-maintained space, perfect for a quiet stroll or relaxing with a book. The greenery is lush, and there are plenty of benches to sit and take in the surroundings. There‚Äôs also a lovely play area for kids, making it great for families. Whether you're looking to escape the hustle and bustle or enjoy a scenic picnic, this park has something for everyone. Highly recommended for nature lovers and anyone wanting a serene break in the city!"
Pretty, quiet and not as crowded as other, more popular parks in town. It's located on a hill, so some spots offer a nice view on the city.

Very cool little park a bit hidden from plain sight even though you see it from the tram. Every year it hosts the Silhouette festival which is a short film festival with great programmation.

One of Paris' hidden gems that not so many know. This park hosts the Silhouette short-film festival at the end of the summer and you can spend lovely evenings on the grass, watching films and listening to music while having a picnic with friends

Not too far from the very busy buttes chaumont - the parc de la Butte du Chapeau rouge has not only a very cool name (coming from an old guingette) but offers a calm family atmosphere and interesting views on the East suburb of Paris.
